intro: Aegialitis, commonly known as sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. These plants are typically found in coastal areas, where they thrive in saline and sandy soils. They are characterized by their distinctive blue or purple flowers and silver-green foliage. Aegialitis species are often used in coastal landscaping due to their hardiness and ability to withstand salt spray. Their ecological importance includes stabilizing dunes and providing habitat for various coastal organisms.
